text: how do dung beetles read the stars to
farmers and ranchers dung beetles are
heroes because they keep soil enriched
and move cattle droppings underground
and away from the livestock to feed
their babies
dung beetles must push their pungent
prize in a straight line stretching up
to 100 yards from where they started but
they sure don't have GPS so how do they
know how to get to where they're going
the Stars how did scientists learn this
researchers began by tracking the
movements of a control group of beetles
that wandered around normally the
researchers affixed another group of
dung beetles with little dung beetle
hats yes there are people who do this
for a living
the hats covered the beetles dorsal eyes
which are located on top of its head
while leaving their ventral eyes which
point toward the ground uncovered even
though the hat-wearing dung beetles
could still see the ground they wandered
around in circles completely lost they
needed to see the sky to get from dung
to dung the double-check their theory
that dung beetles were using the Stars
to navigate scientists took a bunch of
beetles on a field trip to a planetarium
once inside the planetarium the
scientists learned something even more
amazing it's not the bright light of the
stars in moon that the dung beetles
navigate relative to it's actually the
far dimmer glow of the Milky Way because
whenever the Milky Way was covered up
the beetles were completely lost so let
do dung beetles have in common with the
great explorers they navigate the Stars
and have the stomach to go where no one
else wants to
